mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Sarah Tracy to Ann Pamela Cunningham, 1861 April 17
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tracy, Sarah, 1820-1896
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Sarah Tracy, secretary to Ann Pamela Cunningham, April 17, 1861. Washington, D.C. Will attend to furniture to be bought at auction. Mail may stop any day. Thinks Regent cannot spend summer in S.C. Thinks she will go to Mt. Savage. Mr. Riggs sends box sent to him from Baltimore jeweler with oval gold and jet brooch with Houdon profile of Gen. Washington, also two smaller pins. Hopes Regent will go to Columbia.
